summary.para: Sets the relaystate of the message.
If the message being built is a response message, the relaystate will be included unmodified.
If the message being built is a request message, the relaystate will be encoded and compressed before being included.

member.summary: Returns the relaystate that was included with the query. The result will still be encoded according to the rules given in section 3.4.4.1 of [SAMLBind], ie. base64-encoded and DEFLATE-compressed. Use the property RelayStateDecoded to get the decoded contents of the RelayState parameter.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Bindings.HttpRedirectBindingParser.RelayStateDecoded
member.summary: Returns a decoded and decompressed version of the RelayState parameter.

member.name: M:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Bindings.HttpRedirectBindingParser.CheckSignature(System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm)
member.summary: Validates the signature using the public part of the asymmetric key given as parameter.
member.returns: true if the signature is present and can be verified using the given key. false if the signature is present, but can't be verified using the given key.
member.exception: If the query is not signed, and therefore cannot have its signature verified. Use the IsSigned property to check for this situation before calling this method.

member.name: M:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Bindings.HttpRedirectBindingParser.VerifySignature(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.KeyDescriptor})
member.summary: Check the signature of a HTTP-Redirect message using the list of keys.
member.param: A list of KeyDescriptor elements. Probably extracted from the metadata describing the IDP that sent the message.
member.returns: True, if one of the given keys was able to verify the signature. False in all other cases.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.protocol.Saml20MetadataHandler
member.summary:
The handler that exposes a metadata endpoint to the other parties of the federation.
The handler accepts the following GET parameters : - encoding : Delivers the Metadata document in the specified encoding. Example: encoding=iso-8859-1 . If the parameter is omitted, the encoding utf-8 is used. - sign : A boolean parameter specifying whether to sign the metadata document. Example: sign=false. If the parameter is omitted, the document is signed.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.identity.IPersistentPseudonymMapper
member.summary: Implement this interface and register it in web.config on the relevant IdP endpoint to activate mapping of persistent pseudonyms before creating the name of the current IPrincipal. member.summary: Returns the value of the persistent pseudonym issued by the IdP if the Service Provider connection is set up with persistent pseudonyms. Otherwise, returns null.

summary.para: A specialized version of GenericIdentity that contains attributes from a SAML 2 assertion.
The AuthenticationType property of the Identity will be "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:assertion".
The order of the attributes is not maintained when converting from the saml assertion to this class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

summary.para: Retrieves the user's identity and the attributes that were extracted from the saml assertion.
This property may return null if the initialization of the saml identity fails.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Action
member.summary: The <Action> element specifies an action on the specified resource for which permission is sought. Its string-data content provides the label for an action sought to be performed on the specified resource,

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Action.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Action.Namespace
member.summary: Gets or sets the namespace. A URI reference representing the namespace in which the name of the specified action is to be interpreted. If this element is absent, the namespace urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc-negation specified in Section 8.1.2 is in effect.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Action.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Advice
member.summary: The <Advice> element contains any additional information that the SAML authority wishes to provide. This information MAY be ignored by applications without affecting either the semantics or the validity of the assertion.

member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Advice.ItemsElementName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the items element.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion
member.summary: The <Assertion> element is of the AssertionType complex type. This type specifies the basic information that is common to all assertions,

member.name: M:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.Issuer
member.summary: Gets or sets the issuer. The SAML authority that is making the claim(s) in the assertion. The issuer SHOULD be unambiguous to the intended relying parties. This specification defines no particular relationship between the entity represented by this element and the signer of the assertion (if any). Any such requirements imposed

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.Signature
member.summary: Gets or sets the signature. An XML Signature that protects the integrity of and authenticates the issuer of the assertion

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets the subject. The subject of the statement(s) in the assertion

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.Conditions
member.summary: Gets or sets the conditions. Conditions that MUST be evaluated when assessing the validity of and/or when using the assertion.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.Advice
member.summary: Gets or sets the advice. Additional information related to the assertion that assists processing in certain situations but which MAY be ignored by applications that do not understand the advice or do not wish to make use of it.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets the Statements (AttributeStatement, AuthnStatement and AuthzDecisionStatement types)

member.name: M:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.GetAttributeStatements
member.summary: Get the AttributeStatement elements of the Assertion.
member.returns: A list containing the AttributeStatement instances found in the assertion. An empty list if none could be found.

member.name: M:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.GetAuthnStatements
member.summary: Get the AuthnStatement elements of the Assertion.
member.returns: A list containing the AuthnStatement instances found in the assertion. An empty list if none could be found.

member.name: M:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.GetStatements``1
member.summary: Utility method for extracting statements of a particular type from the list of items.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version. The version of this assertion. The identifier for the version of SAML defined in this specification is "2.0".

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID. The identifier for this assertion. It is of type xs:ID, and MUST follow the requirements specified in Section 1.3.4 for identifier uniqueness.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.IssueInstant
member.summary: Gets or sets the issue instant. The time instant of issue in UTC

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.Assertion.IssueInstantString
member.summary: Gets or sets a string representation of the issue instant.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.SamlAttribute
member.summary: The <Attribute> element identifies an attribute by name and optionally includes its value(s). It has the AttributeType complex type. It is used within an attribute statement to express particular attributes and values associated with an assertion subject, as described in the previous section. It is also used in an attribute query to request that the values of specific SAML attributes be returned (see Section 3.3.2.3 for more information).

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.SamlAttribute.NAMEFORMAT_URI
member.summary: Nameformat "uri".

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.SamlAttribute.NAMEFORMAT_BASIC
member.summary: Nameformat "basic".

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.SamlAttribute.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.SamlAttribute.AttributeValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the attribute value. Contains a value of the attribute. If an attribute contains more than one discrete value, it is RECOMMENDED that each value appear in its own <AttributeValue> element. If more than one <AttributeValue> element is supplied for an attribute, and any of the elements have a datatype assigned through xsi:type, then all of the <AttributeValue> elements must have the identical datatype assigned.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.SamlAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name of the attribute.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.SamlAttribute.NameFormat
member.summary: A URI reference representing the classification of the attribute name for purposes of interpreting the name. See Section 8.2 for some URI references that MAY be used as the value of the NameFormat attribute and their associated descriptions and processing rules. If no NameFormat value is provided, the identifier urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:unspecified (see Section 8.2.1) is in effect.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.SamlAttribute.FriendlyName
member.summary: A string that provides a more human-readable form of the attribute's name, which may be useful in cases in which the actual Name is complex or opaque, such as an OID or a UUID. This attribute's value MUST NOT be used as a basis for formally identifying SAML attributes.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.SamlAttribute.AnyAttr
member.summary: Gets or sets any attr.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AttributeStatement
member.summary: The <AttributeStatement> element describes a statement by the SAML authority asserting that the assertion subject is associated with the specified attributes. Assertions containing <AttributeStatement> elements MUST contain a <Subject> element.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AttributeStatement.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AttributeStatement.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets the items. Items may be of type Attribute and EncryptedAttribute

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AudienceRestriction
member.summary: The <AudienceRestriction> element specifies that the assertion is addressed to one or more specific audiences identified by <Audience> elements. Although a SAML relying party that is outside the audiences specified is capable of drawing conclusions from an assertion, the SAML asserting party explicitly makes no representation as to accuracy or trustworthiness to such a party. It contains the following element:

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AudienceRestriction.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AudienceRestriction.Audience
member.summary: Gets or sets the audience. A URI reference that identifies an intended audience. The URI reference MAY identify a document that describes the terms and conditions of audience membership. It MAY also contain the unique identifier URI from a SAML name identifier that describes a system entity

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnContext
member.summary: The <AuthnContext> element specifies the context of an authentication event. The element can contain an authentication context class reference, an authentication context declaration or declaration reference, or both.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnContext.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnContext.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets the items. Items may be of types: AuthnContextClassRef, AuthnContextDecl and AuthnContextDeclRef

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnContext.ItemsElementName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the items element.
member.value: The name of the items element.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnContext.AuthenticatingAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets the authenticating authority. Zero or more unique identifiers of authentication authorities that were involved in the authentication of the principal (not including the assertion issuer, who is presumed to have been involved without being explicitly named here).

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnStatement
member.summary: The <AuthnStatement> element describes a statement by the SAML authority asserting that the assertion subject was authenticated by a particular means at a particular time. Assertions containing <AuthnStatement> elements MUST contain a <Subject> element.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnStatement.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnStatement.SubjectLocality
member.summary: Gets or sets the subject locality. Specifies the DNS domain name and IP address for the system from which the assertion subject was apparently authenticated.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnStatement.AuthnContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the authn context. The context used by the authenticating authority up to and including the authentication event that yielded this statement. Contains an authentication context class reference, an authentication context declaration or declaration reference, or both. See the Authentication Context specification [SAMLAuthnCxt] for a full description of authentication context information.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnStatement.AuthnInstant
member.summary: Gets or sets the authn instant. Specifies the time at which the authentication took place. The time value is encoded in UTC

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnStatement.AuthnInstantString
member.summary: Gets or sets the authn instant string.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnStatement.SessionIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the session. Specifies the index of a particular session between the principal identified by the subject and the authenticating authority.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnStatement.SessionNotOnOrAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets the session not on or after. Specifies a time instant at which the session between the principal identified by the subject and the SAML authority issuing this statement MUST be considered ended. The time value is encoded in UTC, as described in Section 1.3.3. There is no required relationship between this attribute and a NotOnOrAfter condition attribute that may be present in the assertion.
member.value: The session not on or after.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthnStatement.SessionNotOnOrAfterString
member.summary: Gets or sets the session not on or after string.
member.value: The session not on or after string.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthzDecisionStatement
member.summary: The <AuthzDecisionStatement> element describes a statement by the SAML authority asserting that a request for access by the assertion subject to the specified resource has resulted in the specified authorization decision on the basis of some optionally specified evidence. Assertions containing <AuthzDecisionStatement> elements MUST contain a <Subject> element.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthzDecisionStatement.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthzDecisionStatement.Action
member.summary: Gets or sets the action. The set of actions authorized to be performed on the specified resource.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthzDecisionStatement.Evidence
member.summary: Gets or sets the evidence. A set of assertions that the SAML authority relied on in making the decision.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthzDecisionStatement.Resource
member.summary: Gets or sets the resource. A URI reference identifying the resource to which access authorization is sought. This attribute MAY have the value of the empty URI reference (""), and the meaning is defined to be "the start of the current document", as specified by IETF RFC 2396 [RFC 2396] Section 4.2.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.AuthzDecisionStatement.Decision
member.summary: Gets or sets the decision. The decision rendered by the SAML authority with respect to the specified resource. The value is of the DecisionType simple type.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.BaseIDAbstract.SPNameQualifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the SP name qualifier. Further qualifies an identifier with the name of a service provider or affiliation of providers. This attribute provides an additional means to federate identifiers on the basis of the relying party or parties.

The particular confirmation method MUST define the exact mechanism by which the confirmation data can be used. The optional attributes defined by the SubjectConfirmationDataType complex type MAY also appear.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.NameID
member.summary: The NameIDType complex type is used when an element serves to represent an entity by a string-valued name. It is a more restricted form of identifier than the <BaseID> element and is the type underlying both the <NameID> and <Issuer> elements.

member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.NameID.NameQualifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the name qualifier. The security or administrative domain that qualifies the name. This attribute provides a means to federate names from disparate user stores without collision.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.NameID.SPNameQualifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the SP name qualifier. Further qualifies a name with the name of a service provider or affiliation of providers. This attribute provides an additional means to federate names on the basis of the relying party or parties.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.NameID.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format. A URI reference representing the classification of string-based identifier information. See Section 8.3 for the SAML-defined URI references that MAY be used as the value of the Format attribute and their associated descriptions and processing rules. Unless otherwise specified by an element based on this type, if no Format value is provided, then the value urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:nameid-format:unspecified (see Section 8.3.1) is in effect. When a Format value other than one specified in Section 8.3 is used, the content of an element of this type is to be interpreted according to the definition of that format as provided outside of this specification. If not otherwise indicated by the definition of the format, issues of anonymity, pseudonymity, and the persistence of the identifier with respect to the asserting and relying parties are implementation-specific.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.NameID.SPProvidedID
member.summary: Gets or sets the SP provided ID. A name identifier established by a service provider or affiliation of providers for the entity, if different from the primary name identifier given in the content of the element. This attribute provides a means of integrating the use of SAML with existing identifiers already in use by a service provider. For example, an existing identifier can be "attached" to the entity using the Name Identifier Management protocol defined in Section 3.6.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.NameID.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.OneTimeUse
member.summary: In general, relying parties may choose to retain assertions, or the information they contain in some other form, for reuse. The <OneTimeUse> condition element allows an authority to indicate that the information in the assertion is likely to change very soon and fresh information should be obtained for each use. An example would be an assertion containing an <AuthzDecisionStatement> which was the result of a policy which specified access control which was a function of the time of day. If system clocks in a distributed environment could be precisely synchronized, then this requirement could be met by careful use of the validity interval. However, since some clock skew between systems will always be present and will be combined with possible transmission delays, there is no convenient way for the issuer to appropriately limit the lifetime of an assertion without running a substantial risk that it will already have expired before it arrives. The <OneTimeUse> element indicates that the assertion SHOULD be used immediately by the relying party and MUST NOT be retained for future use. Relying parties are always free to request a fresh assertion for every use. However, implementations that choose to retain assertions for future use MUST observe the <OneTimeUse> element. This condition is independent from the NotBefore and NotOnOrAfter condition information. To support the single use constraint, a relying party should maintain a cache of the assertions it has processed containing such a condition. Whenever an assertion with this condition is processed, the cache should be checked to ensure that the same assertion has not been previously received and processed by the relying party. A SAML authority MUST NOT include more than one <OneTimeUse> element within a <Conditions> element of an assertion. For the purposes of determining the validity of the <Conditions> element, the <OneTimeUse> is considered to always be valid. That is, this condition does not affect validity but is a condition on use.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.OneTimeUse.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.ProxyRestriction
member.summary: The Saml20 ProxyRestriction condition class. Specifies limitations that the asserting party imposes on relying parties that wish to subsequently act as asserting parties themselves and issue assertions of their own on the basis of the information contained in the original assertion. Although the schema permits multiple occurrences, there MUST be at most one instance of this element.

member.summary: The <SubjectConfirmation> element provides the means for a relying party to verify the correspondence of the subject of the assertion with the party with whom the relying party is communicating.

member.summary: Gets or sets the subject confirmation data. Additional confirmation information to be used by a specific confirmation method. For example, typical content of this element might be a <ds:KeyInfo> element as defined in the XML Signature Syntax and Processing specification [XMLSig], which identifies a cryptographic key (See also Section 2.4.1.3). Particular confirmation methods MAY define a schema type to describe the elements, attributes, or content that may appear in the <SubjectConfirmationData> element.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.SubjectConfirmation.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the method. A URI reference that identifies a protocol or mechanism to be used to confirm the subject. URI references identifying SAML-defined confirmation methods are currently defined in the SAML profiles specification [SAMLProf]. Additional methods MAY be added by defining new URIs and profiles or by private agreement.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Core.SubjectConfirmationData
member.summary: The <SubjectConfirmationData> element has the SubjectConfirmationDataType complex type. It specifies additional data that allows the subject to be confirmed or constrains the circumstances under which the act of subject confirmation can take place. Subject confirmation takes place when a relying party seeks to verify the relationship between an entity presenting the assertion (that is, the attesting entity) and the subject of the assertion's claims.

Its AdditionalMetadataLocationType complex type extends the anyURI type with a namespace attribute (also of type anyURI). This required attribute MUST contain the XML namespace of the root element of the instance document found at the specified location.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.AffiliationDescriptor
member.summary: The <AffiliationDescriptor> element is an alternative to the sequence of role descriptors described in Section 2.4 that is used when an <EntityDescriptor> describes an affiliation of SAML entities (typically service providers) rather than a single entity. The <AffiliationDescriptor> element provides a summary of the individual entities that make up the affiliation along with general information about the affiliation itself.

member.summary: Gets or sets the affiliation owner ID. Specifies the unique identifier of the entity responsible for the affiliation. The owner is NOT presumed to be a member of the affiliation; if it is a member, its identifier MUST also appear in an <AffiliateMember> element.

member.summary: Gets or sets the telephone number. Zero or more string elements specifying a telephone number of the contact person.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the contact. Specifies the type of contact using the ContactTypeType enumeration. The possible values are technical, support, administrative, billing, and other.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Contact.AnyAttr
member.summary: Gets or sets any attr.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Endpoint
member.summary: The complex type EndpointType describes a SAML protocol binding endpoint at which a SAML entity can be sent protocol messages. Various protocol or profile-specific metadata elements are bound to this type.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Endpoint.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Endpoint.Any
member.summary: Gets or sets any.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Endpoint.Binding
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding. A required attribute that specifies the SAML binding supported by the endpoint. Each binding is assigned a URI to identify it.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Endpoint.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the location. A required URI attribute that specifies the location of the endpoint. The allowable syntax of this URI depends on the protocol binding.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Endpoint.ResponseLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the response location. Optionally specifies a different location to which response messages sent as part of the protocol or profile should be sent. The allowable syntax of this URI depends on the protocol binding.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Endpoint.AnyAttr
member.summary: Gets or sets any attr.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntitiesDescriptor
member.summary: The <EntitiesDescriptor> element contains the metadata for an optionally named group of SAML entities.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntitiesDescriptor.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntitiesDescriptor.Signature
member.summary: Gets or sets the signature. An XML signature that authenticates the containing element and its contents

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntitiesDescriptor.Extensions
member.summary: Gets or sets the extensions. This contains optional metadata extensions that are agreed upon between a metadata publisher and consumer. Extension elements MUST be namespace-qualified by a non-SAML-defined namespace.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntitiesDescriptor.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets the items. Contains the metadata for one or more SAML entities, or a nested group of additional metadata

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntitiesDescriptor.validUntil
member.summary: Gets or sets the valid until. Optional attribute indicates the expiration time of the metadata contained in the element and any contained elements.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntitiesDescriptor.validUntilString
member.summary: Gets or sets the valid until string.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntitiesDescriptor.validUntilSpecified
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [valid until specified].
member.value: true if [valid until specified]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntitiesDescriptor.cacheDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the cache duration. Optional attribute indicates the maximum length of time a consumer should cache the metadata contained in the element and any contained elements.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntitiesDescriptor.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID. A document-unique identifier for the element, typically used as a reference point when signing

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntitiesDescriptor.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name. A string name that identifies a group of SAML entities in the context of some deployment.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor
member.summary: The <EntityDescriptor> element specifies metadata for a single SAML entity. A single entity may act in many different roles in the support of multiple profiles. This specification directly supports the following concrete roles as well as the abstract <RoleDescriptor> element for extensibility (see subsequent sections for more details): * SSO Identity Provider * SSO Service Provider * Authentication Authority * Attribute Authority * Policy Decision Point * Affiliation

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.Signature
member.summary: Gets or sets the signature. An XML signature that authenticates the containing element and its contents

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.Extensions
member.summary: Gets or sets the extensions. This contains optional metadata extensions that are agreed upon between a metadata publisher and consumer. Extension elements MUST be namespace-qualified by a non-SAML-defined namespace.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets the items. <RoleDescriptor>, <IDPSSODescriptor>, <SPSSODescriptor>, <AuthnAuthorityDescriptor>, <AttributeAuthorityDescriptor>, <PDPDescriptor> <AffiliationDescriptor>

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.Organization
member.summary: Gets or sets the organization. Optional element identifying the organization responsible for the SAML entity described by the element.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.ContactPerson
member.summary: Gets or sets the contact person. Optional sequence of elements identifying various kinds of contact personnel.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.AdditionalMetadataLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional metadata location. Optional sequence of namespace-qualified locations where additional metadata exists for the SAML entity. This may include metadata in alternate formats or describing adherence to other non-SAML specifications.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.entityID
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity ID. Specifies the unique identifier of the SAML entity whose metadata is described by the element's contents.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.validUntil
member.summary: Gets or sets the valid until. Optional attribute indicates the expiration time of the metadata contained in the element and any contained elements.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.validUntilString
member.summary: Gets or sets the valid until string. Optional attribute indicates the expiration time of the metadata contained in the element and any contained elements.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.cacheDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the cache duration. Optional attribute indicates the maximum length of time a consumer should cache the metadata contained in the element and any contained elements.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID. A document-unique identifier for the element, typically used as a reference point when signing

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.AnyAttr
member.summary: Gets or sets any attr.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IDPSSODescriptor
member.summary: The <IDPSSODescriptor> element extends SSODescriptorType with content reflecting profiles specific to identity providers supporting SSO.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IDPSSODescriptor.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IDPSSODescriptor.SingleSignOnService
member.summary: Gets or sets the single sign on service. One or more elements of type EndpointType that describe endpoints that support the profiles of the Authentication Request protocol defined in [SAMLProf]. All identity providers support at least one such endpoint, by definition. The ResponseLocation attribute MUST be omitted.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IDPSSODescriptor.NameIDMappingService
member.summary: Gets or sets the name ID mapping service. Zero or more elements of type EndpointType that describe endpoints that support the Name Identifier Mapping profile defined in [SAMLProf]. The ResponseLocation attribute MUST be omitted.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IDPSSODescriptor.AssertionIDRequestService
member.summary: Gets or sets the assertion ID request service. Zero or more elements of type EndpointType that describe endpoints that support the profile of the Assertion Request protocol defined in [SAMLProf] or the special URI binding for assertion requests defined in [SAMLBind].

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IDPSSODescriptor.AttributeProfile
member.summary: Gets or sets the attribute profile. Zero or more elements of type anyURI that enumerate the attribute profiles supported by this identity provider. See [SAMLProf] for some possible values for this element.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IDPSSODescriptor.Attributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the attribute. Zero or more elements that identify the SAML attributes supported by the identity provider. Specific values MAY optionally be included, indicating that only certain values permitted by the attribute's definition are supported. In this context, "support" for an attribute means that the identity provider has the capability to include it when delivering assertions during single sign-on.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IDPSSODescriptor.WantAuthnRequestsSigned
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [want authn requests signed]. Optional attribute that indicates a requirement for the <samlp:AuthnRequest> messages received by this identity provider to be signed. If omitted, the value is assumed to be false.
member.value: true if [want authn requests signed]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IDPSSODescriptor.WantAuthnRequestsSignedSpecified
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [want authn requests signed specified].
member.value: true if [want authn requests signed specified]; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IndexedEndpoint
member.summary: The complex type IndexedEndpointType extends EndpointType with a pair of attributes to permit the indexing of otherwise identical endpoints so that they can be referenced by protocol messages.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IndexedEndpoint.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IndexedEndpoint.index
member.summary: Gets or sets the index. A required attribute that assigns a unique integer value to the endpoint so that it can be referenced in a protocol message. The index value need only be unique within a collection of like elements contained within the same parent element (i.e., they need not be unique across the entire instance).

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IndexedEndpoint.isDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is default. An optional boolean attribute used to designate the default endpoint among an indexed set. If omitted, the value is assumed to be false.
member.value: true if this instance is default; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.IndexedEndpoint.isDefaultString
member.summary: Gets or sets the isDefault string.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.KeyDescriptor
member.summary: The <KeyDescriptor> element provides information about the cryptographic key(s) that an entity uses to sign data or receive encrypted keys, along with additional cryptographic details.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.KeyDescriptor.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.KeyDescriptor.KeyInfo
member.summary: The XML Signature element KeyInfo. Can be implicitly converted to the .NET class System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.KeyDescriptor.EncryptionMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the encryption method. Optional element specifying an algorithm and algorithm-specific settings supported by the entity. The exact content varies based on the algorithm supported. See [XMLEnc] for the definition of this element's xenc:EncryptionMethodType complex type.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.KeyDescriptor.use
member.summary: Gets or sets the use. Optional attribute specifying the purpose of the key being described. Values are drawn from the KeyTypes enumeration, and consist of the values encryption and signing.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.KeyDescriptor.useSpecified
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [use specified].

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Organization
member.summary: The <Organization> element specifies basic information about an organization responsible for a SAML entity or role. The use of this element is always optional. Its content is informative in nature and does not directly map to any core SAML elements or attributes.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Organization.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Organization.Extensions
member.summary: Gets or sets the extensions. This contains optional metadata extensions that are agreed upon between a metadata publisher and consumer. Extensions MUST NOT include global (non-namespace-qualified) elements or elements qualified by a SAML-defined namespace within this element.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Organization.OrganizationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the organization. One or more language-qualified names that may or may not be suitable for human consumption

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Organization.OrganizationDisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name of the organization. One or more language-qualified names that are suitable for human consumption.
member.value: The display name of the organization.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Organization.OrganizationURL
member.summary: Gets or sets the organization URL. One or more language-qualified URIs that specify a location to which to direct a user for additional information. Note that the language qualifier refers to the content of the material at the specified location.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.Organization.AnyAttr
member.summary: Gets or sets any attr.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.PDPDescriptor
member.summary: The <PDPDescriptor> element extends RoleDescriptorType with content reflecting profiles specific to policy decision points, SAML authorities that respond to <samlp:AuthzDecisionQuery> messages.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.PDPDescriptor.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.PDPDescriptor.AuthzService
member.summary: Gets or sets the authz service. One or more elements of type EndpointType that describe endpoints that support the profile of the Authorization Decision Query protocol defined in [SAMLProf]. All policy decision points support at least one such endpoint, by definition.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.PDPDescriptor.AssertionIDRequestService
member.summary: Gets or sets the assertion ID request service. Zero or more elements of type EndpointType that describe endpoints that support the profile of the Assertion Request protocol defined in [SAMLProf] or the special URI binding for assertion requests defined in [SAMLBind].

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.PDPDescriptor.NameIDFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the name ID format. Zero or more elements of type anyURI that enumerate the name identifier formats supported by this authority.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RequestedAttribute
member.summary: The <RequestedAttribute> element specifies a service provider's interest in a specific SAML attribute, optionally including specific values.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RequestedAttribute.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RequestedAttribute.isRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is required. Optional XML attribute indicates if the service requires the corresponding SAML attribute in order to function at all (as opposed to merely finding an attribute useful or desirable).
member.value: true if this instance is required; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RequestedAttribute.isRequiredString
member.summary: Gets or sets the is required string.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor
member.summary: The <RoleDescriptor> element is an abstract extension point that contains common descriptive information intended to provide processing commonality across different roles. New roles can be defined by extending its abstract RoleDescriptorType complex type

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.Signature
member.summary: Gets or sets the signature. An XML signature that authenticates the containing element and its contents

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.Extensions
member.summary: Gets or sets the extensions. This contains optional metadata extensions that are agreed upon between a metadata publisher and consumer. Extension elements MUST be namespace-qualified by a non-SAML-defined namespace.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.KeyDescriptor
member.summary: Gets or sets the key descriptor. Optional sequence of elements that provides information about the cryptographic keys that the entity uses when acting in this role.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.Organization
member.summary: Gets or sets the organization. Optional element specifies the organization associated with this role. Identical to the element used within the <EntityDescriptor> element.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.ContactPerson
member.summary: Gets or sets the contact person. Optional sequence of elements specifying contacts associated with this role. Identical to the element used within the <EntityDescriptor> element.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID. A document-unique identifier for the element, typically used as a reference point when signing.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.validUntil
member.summary: Gets or sets the valid until. Optional attribute indicates the expiration time of the metadata contained in the element and any contained elements.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.validUntilString
member.summary: Gets or sets the valid until string.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.cacheDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the cache duration. Optional attribute indicates the maximum length of time a consumer should cache the metadata contained in the element and any contained elements.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.protocolSupportEnumerationAsString
member.summary: Gets or sets the protocol support enumeration. A whitespace-delimited set of URIs that identify the set of protocol specifications supported by the role element. For SAML V2.0 entities, this set MUST include the SAML protocol namespace URI, urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:protocol. Note that future SAML specifications might share the same namespace URI, but SHOULD provide alternate "protocol support" identifiers to ensure discrimination when necessary.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.protocolSupportEnumeration
member.summary: Gets or sets the protocol support enumeration. The array is a set of URIs that identify the set of protocol specifications supported by the role element.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.errorURL
member.summary: Gets or sets the error URL. Optional URI attribute that specifies a location to direct a user for problem resolution and additional support related to this role.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.RoleDescriptor.AnyAttr
member.summary: Gets or sets any attr.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.SPSSODescriptor
member.summary: The <SPSSODescriptor> element extends SSODescriptorType with content reflecting profiles specific to service providers.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.SPSSODescriptor.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.SPSSODescriptor.AssertionConsumerService
member.summary: Gets or sets the assertion consumer service. One or more elements that describe indexed endpoints that support the profiles of the Authentication Request protocol defined in [SAMLProf]. All service providers support at least one such endpoint, by definition.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.SPSSODescriptor.AttributeConsumingService
member.summary: Gets or sets the attribute consuming service. Zero or more elements that describe an application or service provided by the service provider that requires or desires the use of SAML attributes.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.SPSSODescriptor.AuthnRequestsSigned
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [authn requests signed]. Optional attribute that indicates whether the <samlp:AuthnRequest> messages sent by this service provider will be signed. If omitted, the value is assumed to be false.
member.value: true if [authn requests signed]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.SPSSODescriptor.WantAssertionsSigned
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [want assertions signed]. Optional attribute that indicates a requirement for the <saml:Assertion> elements received by this service provider to be signed. If omitted, the value is assumed to be false. This requirement is in addition to any requirement for signing derived from the use of a particular profile/binding combination.
member.value: true if [want assertions signed]; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.SSODescriptor
member.summary: The SSODescriptorType abstract type is a common base type for the concrete types SPSSODescriptorType and IDPSSODescriptorType, described in subsequent sections. It extends RoleDescriptorType with elements reflecting profiles common to both identity providers and service providers that support SSO

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.SSODescriptor.ArtifactResolutionService
member.summary: Gets or sets the artifact resolution service. Zero or more elements of type IndexedEndpointType that describe indexed endpoints that support the Artifact Resolution profile defined in [SAMLProf]. The ResponseLocation attribute MUST be omitted.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.SSODescriptor.SingleLogoutService
member.summary: Gets or sets the single logout service. Zero or more elements of type EndpointType that describe endpoints that support the Single Logout profiles defined in [SAMLProf].

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.SSODescriptor.ManageNameIDService
member.summary: Gets or sets the manage name ID service. Zero or more elements of type EndpointType that describe endpoints that support the Name Identifier Management profiles defined in [SAMLProf].

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Metadata.SSODescriptor.NameIDFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the name ID format. Zero or more elements of type anyURI that enumerate the name identifier formats supported by this system entity acting in this role. See Section 8.3 of [SAMLCore] for some possible values for this element.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.ArtifactResolve
member.summary: The <ArtifactResolve> message is used to request that a SAML protocol message be returned in an <ArtifactResponse> message by specifying an artifact that represents the SAML protocol message. The original transmission of the artifact is governed by the specific protocol binding that is being used; see [SAMLBind] for more information on the use of artifacts in bindings

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.ArtifactResolve.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.ArtifactResolve.Artifact
member.summary: Gets or sets the artifact. The artifact value that the requester received and now wishes to translate into the protocol message it represents. See [SAMLBind] for specific artifact format information.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.ArtifactResponse
member.summary: The recipient of an <ArtifactResolve> message MUST respond with an <ArtifactResponse> message element. This element is of complex type ArtifactResponseType, which extends StatusResponseType with a single optional wildcard element corresponding to the SAML protocol message being returned. This wrapped message element can be a request or a response.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.ArtifactResponse.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.ArtifactResponse.Any
member.summary: Gets or sets any.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AssertionIDRequest
member.summary: If the requester knows the unique identifier of one or more assertions, the <AssertionIDRequest> message element can be used to request that they be returned in a <Response> message. The <saml:AssertionIDRef> element is used to specify each assertion to return. See Section 2.3.1 for more information on this element.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AssertionIDRequest.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AssertionIDRequest.AssertionIDRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the assertion ID ref.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AttributeQuery
member.summary: The <AttributeQuery> element is used to make the query "Return the requested attributes for this subject." A successful response will be in the form of assertions containing attribute statements, to the extent allowed by policy.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AttributeQuery.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AttributeQuery.SamlAttribute
member.summary: Gets or sets the attribute. Each <saml:Attribute> element specifies an attribute whose value(s) are to be returned. If no attributes are specified, it indicates that all attributes allowed by policy are requested. If a given <saml:Attribute> element contains one or more <saml:AttributeValue> elements, then if that attribute is returned in the response, it MUST NOT contain any values that are not equal to the values specified in the query. In the absence of equality rules specified by particular profiles or attributes, equality is defined as an identical XML representation of the value

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnQuery
member.summary: The <AuthnQuery> message element is used to make the query "What assertions containing authentication statements are available for this subject?" A successful <Response> will contain one or more assertions containing authentication statements.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnQuery.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnQuery.RequestedAuthnContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the requested authn context. If present, specifies a filter for possible responses. Such a query asks the question "What assertions containing authentication statements do you have for this subject that satisfy the authentication context requirements in this element?"

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnQuery.SessionIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the session. If present, specifies a filter for possible responses. Such a query asks the question "What assertions containing authentication statements do you have for this subject within the context of the supplied session information?"

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest
member.summary: To request that an identity provider issue an assertion with an authentication statement, a presenter authenticates to that identity provider (or relies on an existing security context) and sends it an <AuthnRequest> message that describes the properties that the resulting assertion needs to have to satisfy its purpose. Among these properties may be information that relates to the content of the assertion and/or information that relates to how the resulting <Response> message should be delivered to the requester. The process of authentication of the presenter may take place before, during, or after the initial delivery of the <AuthnRequest> message. The requester might not be the same as the presenter of the request if, for example, the requester is a relying party that intends to use the resulting assertion to authenticate or authorize the requested subject so that the relying party can decide whether to provide a service. The <AuthnRequest> message SHOULD be signed or otherwise authenticated and integrity protected by the protocol binding used to deliver the message.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets the subject. Specifies the requested subject of the resulting assertion(s). This may include one or more <saml:SubjectConfirmation> elements to indicate how and/or by whom the resulting assertions can be confirmed.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.NameIDPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets the name ID policy. Specifies constraints on the name identifier to be used to represent the requested subject. If omitted, then any type of identifier supported by the identity provider for the requested subject can be used, constrained by any relevant deployment-specific policies, with respect to privacy, for example

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.Conditions
member.summary: Gets or sets the conditions. Specifies the SAML conditions the requester expects to limit the validity and/or use of the resulting assertion(s). The responder MAY modify or supplement this set as it deems necessary. The information in this element is used as input to the process of constructing the assertion, rather than as conditions on the use of the request itself.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.RequestedAuthnContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the requested authn context. Specifies the requirements, if any, that the requester places on the authentication context that applies to the responding provider's authentication of the presenter. See Section 3.3.2.2.1 for processing rules regarding this element.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.Scoping
member.summary: Gets or sets the scoping. Specifies a set of identity providers trusted by the requester to authenticate the presenter, as well as limitations and context related to proxying of the <AuthnRequest> message to subsequent identity providers by the responder

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.ForceAuthn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [force authn]. A Boolean value. If "true", the identity provider MUST authenticate the presenter directly rather than rely on a previous security context. If a value is not provided, the default is "false". However, if both ForceAuthn and IsPassive are "true", the identity provider MUST NOT freshly authenticate the presenter unless the constraints of IsPassive can be met.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.ForceAuthnString
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [force authn specified].
member.value: true if [force authn specified]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.IsPassive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is passive. A Boolean value. If "true", the identity provider and the user agent itself MUST NOT visibly take control of the user interface from the requester and interact with the presenter in a noticeable fashion. If a value is not provided, the default is "false".
member.value: true if this instance is passive; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.IsPassiveString
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is passive specified.
member.value: true if this instance is passive specified; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.ProtocolBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the protocol binding. A URI reference that identifies a SAML protocol binding to be used when returning the <Response> message. See [SAMLBind] for more information about protocol bindings and URI references defined for them. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the AssertionConsumerServiceIndex attribute and is typically accompanied by the AssertionConsumerServiceURL attribute.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.AssertionConsumerServiceIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the assertion consumer service. Indirectly identifies the location to which the <Response> message should be returned to the requester. It applies only to profiles in which the requester is different from the presenter, such as the Web Browser SSO profile in [SAMLProf]. The identity provider MUST have a trusted means to map the index value in the attribute to a location associated with the requester. [SAMLMeta] provides one possible mechanism. If omitted, then the identity provider MUST return the <Response> message to the default location associated with the requester for the profile of use. If the index specified is invalid, then the identity provider MAY return an error <Response> or it MAY use the default location. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the AssertionConsumerServiceURL and ProtocolBinding attributes.
member.value: The index of the assertion consumer service.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.AssertionConsumerServiceIndexSpecified
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [assertion consumer service index specified].
member.value: true if [assertion consumer service index specified]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.AssertionConsumerServiceURL
member.summary: Gets or sets the assertion consumer service URL. Specifies by value the location to which the <Response> message MUST be returned to the requester. The responder MUST ensure by some means that the value specified is in fact associated with the requester. [SAMLMeta] provides one possible mechanism; signing the enclosing <AuthnRequest> message is another. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the AssertionConsumerServiceIndex attribute and is typically accompanied by the ProtocolBinding attribute.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.AttributeConsumingServiceIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the attribute consuming service. Indirectly identifies information associated with the requester describing the SAML attributes the requester desires or requires to be supplied by the identity provider in the <Response> message. The identity provider MUST have a trusted means to map the index value in the attribute to information associated with the requester. [SAMLMeta] provides one possible mechanism. The identity provider MAY use this information to populate one or more <saml:AttributeStatement> elements in the assertion(s) it returns.
member.value: The index of the attribute consuming service.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.AttributeConsumingServiceIndexSpecified
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [attribute consuming service index specified].
member.value: true if [attribute consuming service index specified]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthnRequest.ProviderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the provider. Specifies the human-readable name of the requester for use by the presenter's user agent or the identity provider.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthzDecisionQuery
member.summary: The <AuthzDecisionQuery> element is used to make the query "Should these actions on this resource be allowed for this subject, given this evidence?" A successful response will be in the form of assertions containing authorization decision statements. Note: The <AuthzDecisionQuery> feature has been frozen as of SAML V2.0, with no future enhancements planned. Users who require additional functionality may want to consider the eXtensible Access Control Markup Language [XACML], which offers enhanced authorization decision features.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthzDecisionQuery.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthzDecisionQuery.Action
member.summary: Gets or sets the action. The actions for which authorization is requested.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthzDecisionQuery.Evidence
member.summary: Gets or sets the evidence. A set of assertions that the SAML authority MAY rely on in making its authorization decision

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.AuthzDecisionQuery.Resource
member.summary: Gets or sets the resource. A URI reference indicating the resource for which authorization is requested.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.EncryptedAssertion
member.summary: The <EncryptedAssertion> element represents an assertion in encrypted fashion, as defined by the XML Encryption Syntax and Processing specification [XMLEnc].

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.EncryptedAssertion.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.EncryptedElement
member.summary: Represents an encrypted element

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.EncryptedElement.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.EncryptedElement.encryptedData
member.summary: Gets or sets the encrypted data.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.EncryptedElement.encryptedKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the encrypted key.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.Extensions
member.summary: This extension point contains optional protocol message extension elements that are agreed on between the communicating parties. No extension schema is required in order to make use of this extension point, and even if one is provided, the lax validation setting does not impose a requirement for the extension to be valid. SAML extension elements MUST be namespace-qualified in a non- SAML-defined namespace.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.Extensions.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.Extensions.Any
member.summary: Gets or sets any.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.IDPEntry
member.summary: The <IDPEntry> element specifies a single identity provider trusted by the requester to authenticate the presenter.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.IDPEntry.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.IDPEntry.ProviderID
member.summary: Gets or sets the provider ID. The unique identifier of the identity provider.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.IDPEntry.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name. A human-readable name for the identity provider

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.IDPEntry.Loc
member.summary: Gets or sets the loc. A URI reference representing the location of a profile-specific endpoint supporting the authentication request protocol. The binding to be used must be understood from the profile of use.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.IDPList
member.summary: The <IDPList> element specifies the identity providers trusted by the requester to authenticate the presenter.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.IDPList.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.IDPList.IDPEntry
member.summary: Gets or sets the IDP entry. Information about a single identity provider.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.IDPList.GetComplete
member.summary: Gets or sets the get complete. If the <IDPList> is not complete, using this element specifies a URI reference that can be used to retrieve the complete list. Retrieving the resource associated with the URI MUST result in an XML instance whose root element is an <IDPList> that does not itself contain a <GetComplete> element.

member.name: T:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.LogoutRequest
member.summary: A session participant or session authority sends a <LogoutRequest> message to indicate that a session has been terminated.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.LogoutRequest.REASON_USER
member.summary: Specifies that the message is being sent because the principal wishes to terminate the indicated session.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.LogoutRequest.REASON_ADMIN
member.summary: Specifies that the message is being sent because an administrator wishes to terminate the indicated session for the principal.

member.name: F:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.LogoutRequest.ELEMENT_NAME
member.summary: The XML Element name of this class

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.LogoutRequest.Item
member.summary: Gets or sets the item. The identifier and associated attributes (in plaintext or encrypted form) that specify the principal as currently recognized by the identity and service providers prior to this request.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.LogoutRequest.SessionIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the session.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.LogoutRequest.Reason
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.LogoutRequest.NotOnOrAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets NotOnOrAfter.

member.name: P:nz.govt.moe.idp.saml.client.Schema.Protocol.LogoutRequest.NotOnOrAfterString
member.summary: Gets or sets the issue instant string.
